page.title: 05BROADWAY ALMS HOUSES
page.content: The Alms Houses were built in 1588,by J.V.Baker and sons.The descendants of those Bakers are still builders in Broadway today. Some of the walls upstairs are of the original wattle and daub.Upstairs and downstairs there are still the original oak beams.The windows have got hamstone frames,the glass is slightly coloured.Wooden pegs are used to hold the beams together instead of nails. There were originally seven houses but now there are only four.Today they are used for old people to live in,they have central heating fitted in every room.The people don't have to pay rent because there is a trustee scheme.
